Quickstrike:





It wasn't long until the dizziness started again. Quickstrike forced 
more careful steps in walking so he wouldn't loose his balance and 
fall. 

He could feel it, his body was fighting the cold as well as trying to 
stable his odd damage. It was internal, he knew that. If it was fatal 
or not, he couldn't tell. Sometimes a bot couldn't find that out 
until it was too late. He just didn't trust Megatron around with this 
sort of damage. He was nervous that he could kill him, if he thought 
he couldn't stand up to his duties. 

Being made for war was sometimes difficult, but he took pride in it 
because he liked it. He was used to it. It was instinct for him to 
fight.

He had to close his optics a few times to stop himself from loosing 
his orientation. If he had some energy maybe he could straighten his 
problem out a little bit more. Maybe all he needed to fix it was 
energy that was used up. He stopped to think what he could do. 

He looked around at the vast snowy wasteland. It was like his lone 
trip to Asia he did a while ago. He turned and walked off towards the 
east, taking a mile to get to another spot that was no promising of 
hunting. It would be easy. He knew of few tricks on lone hunting. His 
robot mode worked the best because he didn't have to run after it. 
And running after something in the snow like this would be the 
Inferno. He could manage the terrain and weather, but not like this. 
His trip to Asia gave him some experience, as well as his short 
training from Rowdy Wolf.
